Yes, there are some restaurants that provide education to their customers on ways they can be more sustainable in their own homes. Here are a few examples:

1. The Farmacy - This London-based restaurant provides educational classes on topics such as how to grow your own herbs and the benefits of plant-based eating.

2. Avec - This Chicago restaurant provides a "Waste Zero" pamphlet that includes tips on how to reduce waste at home and compost properly.

3. Methode Brigitte Kettner - This Munich-based restaurant provides customized diet plans that are designed to be environmentally sustainable.

4. Honeygrow - This fast-casual chain provides educational materials on topics such as reducing food waste and the benefits of eating locally sourced ingredients.

5. Standard Market Grill - This Illinois-based restaurant provides cooking demonstrations that teach customers how to make plant-based meals and reduce food waste at home.

6. Blue Hill at Stone Barns - This New York restaurant hosts a "Young Farmers Program" that teaches children about sustainable farming practices and the importance of locally sourced food.

These are just a few examples of restaurants that provide education to their customers on sustainable practices. By providing education, restaurants can inspire their customers to make positive changes in their own lives and contribute to a more sustainable future.
